strings.Value: "Yes, Jhod. We found the source of the infection and destroyed it once and for all. They won't be back."
"What difference does that make, you weakling? You're just going to die on me now? You're such a letdown, to me and the entire town!"

"Hey, Jhod, what do you think you're doing? If you're thinking of hopping the twig, you'd best think again, old man! I need someone around who can cure the immense hangover I'll have after tomorrow's feast, you know?"
"Are you all right?"
"How bad is the wound?"
"What happened here?"
"What will you do next?"
[Leave] "I need to go."
"I'm in need of healing."
"We found where the fiends are coming from. Now we just need to pay them a visit and dispose of this threat."
"We found and destroyed the source of the infection. There won't be anymore seeds."
{n}Jhod Kavken lies on the ground, broken and bloody. When he sees you, he groans quietly. You can tell there's no saving the old priest.{/n} "The city..." {n}he whispers.{/n} "Is the city... safe?"

{n}The old priest winces. He's holding his side, and while bloodstains are slowly spreading on his clothes, it's clear that his life isn't in danger.{/n} "You came! I prayed to {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g} that you would make it in time!"

{n}The priest whispers a prayer and touches the wound on the warrior's hip, then the wound immediately begins to close. Jhod lifts his eyes and notices you.{/n} "Praised be {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g}, you made it!"
"You're the best thing... these lands have seen... in centuries... Take care of yourself... And take care of them..."
"You're... an evil {mf|man|woman}..." {n}Jhod coughs wetly, and blood runs down his chin.{/n} "But these lands... have no other protector... It falls to you... There is... no one else..."
{n}The priest's eyes roll back. He dies with a grimace on his face.{/n}

{n}Jhod laughs sharply, but it immediately becomes a wet cough, and blood runs down his chin.{/n} "Yes... you are mad after all... But I wouldn't want... anyone else... protecting these lands... Take care of them..."
{n}The priest's eyes roll back. He dies with a smile on his broken lips.{/n}
{n}Jhod's eyes roll back. His bloodied face looks almost serene.{/n}
A trifle... Nothing a prayer to {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g} couldn't cure. But my wound can wait — the townsfolk are in greater need of divine aid than I am."

"I had just finished an operation and was preparing for the next one when all the remaining patients... bloomed. There were no survivors. I managed to fight my way to the street — and landed straight in this monster's claws! I was running out of spells and stamina... If it weren't for you, I'd have met my end."
"There are still many wounded in the city streets. I aim to help everyone I can."
"Go, Your Grace. I must leave as well — the battle isn't over yet. Horrendous creatures prowl the streets, and there are wounded in need of aid. {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g} save us all!"
"Hardly a scratch, Your Grace. I'm afraid the same can't be said of many of the townsfolk..."
{n}The priest clutches his holy symbol and whispers a prayer.{/n}
"Right, all hail me... Thanks for knocking some sense back into me. Not sure I could live with myself if Jhod had been gobbled up while I was playing hero out there."
"Praise to {g|Erastil}Erastil{/g}, shield of these lands! Once the battle is over, you must make your way there and destroy the source of this plague! Burn everything in your sight, if need be!"
"This is joyous news... or would be, in most any other situation... Still, praised be your name, our deliverer. You've saved your realm and rescued the people!"
{n}Kesten gives a short bow and follows Jhod out.{/n}
